utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Hey Eddie. Daahh!! What're you doin' here?

utterance.speaker: EDDIE
utterance.content: Nothin' roomie, just watchin' you sleep.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: EDDIE
utterance.content: Makes me feel um, peaceful, heh-heh, please.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: I can't sleep now.

utterance.speaker: EDDIE
utterance.content: You want me to sing?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: No, look, that's it, it's over, I want you out, I want you out of the apartment now.

utterance.speaker: EDDIE
utterance.content: Woah, woah, woah, what're, what're you talkin' about man.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Hannibal Lecter...better roommate than you.

utterance.speaker: EDDIE
utterance.content: No. See now I don't think you're being fair. I mean one night you see me and you get scared, I mean, what about all the other nights when you don't see me, huh? What about last night when you went and got a drink of water and I was nice enough to hide behind the door, what's that about, huh?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: I didn't realize that.

utterance.speaker: EDDIE
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: GET OUT NOW!!

utterance.speaker: EDDIE
utterance.content: Ok, you really want me out?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Yes please.

utterance.speaker: EDDIE
utterance.content: Ok, then I want to hear you say it, I, I want to hear you say you want me out.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: I want you out.

utterance.speaker: EDDIE
utterance.content: No no no, I wanna hear it from your lips.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Where did you hear it from before?

utterance.speaker: EDDIE
utterance.content: Oh, right, all right, you know what pallie I understand, consider me gone, you know what, I'll be out by the time you get home from work tomorrow.

utterance.speaker: EDDIE
utterance.content: I heard that.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Hey. Whe-ell, look at you, finally got that time machine workin' huh?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Seriously, you like it? This guy was sellin' them on 8th avenue and I looked at 'em and I though, you know what I don't have?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: A mirror?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Fine, make fun. I think it's jaunty.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Wow, for a guy who's recently lost his job, you're in an awfully good mood.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Hey, I'll be alright. I mean it's not like I'm starting from sqare one. I was Dr. Drake Remoray on Days of Our Lives. Heh? I mean that's gotta have some kind of cache.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Cache? Jaunty?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Chandler gave me word of the day toilet paper. I'm gonna get some coffee.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Oooh, so so so, did you read the book?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Oh my God, it was incredible.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Didn't it like totally speak to you?

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Woah, woah, woah, what book is this?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Rachel you have to read this book. It's called Be Your Own Windkeeper. It's about how women need to become more empowered.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Yeah and oh, and but there's, there's wind and the wind can make us Goddesses. But you know who takes out wind? Men, they just take it.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Men just take out wind?

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Ya-huh, all the time, cause they are the lightning bearers.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Wow.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Well that sounds kinda cool, kinda like The Hobbit.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: It is nothing like the Hobbit. It's like reading about every relationship I've ever had, except for Richard.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Oh yes, no, Richard would never steal your wind.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: No, 'cause he's yummy.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Yes. But all the other ones.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Oh yes. Oh and, the part about how they're always like drinking from out pool of inner power, but God forbid we should take a sip.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Anybody want a croan.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Ok, this is a typical lightning-bearer thing. Right there, it's like, um, 'Hello, who wants one of my fallic shaped man cakes?'

utterance.speaker: ESTELLE
utterance.content: Don't worry about it already. Things happen.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: So, you're not mad at me for getting fired and everything?

utterance.speaker: ESTELLE
utterance.content: Joey, look at me, look at me. Do I have lipstick on my teeth?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: No, can we get back to me?

utterance.speaker: ESTELLE
utterance.content: Look honey, people get fired left and right in this business. I already got you an audition for Another World.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Alright. Cab driver number two?

utterance.speaker: ESTELLE
utterance.content: You're welcome.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: But I was Dr. Drake Remoray. How can I go from bein' a neurosurgeon to drivin' a cab?

utterance.speaker: ESTELLE
utterance.content: Things change, roll with em.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: But this is a two line part, it's like takin' a step backwards. I'm not gonna do this.

utterance.speaker: ESTELLE
utterance.content: Joey, I'm gonna tell you the same thing I told Al Minser and his pyramid of dogs. Take any job you can get and don't make on the floor.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: I'm sorry. See ya.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Oh, God, oh, God, I mean it's just so.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Isn't it.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Uhh, I mean this is like reading about my own life. I mean this book could have been called 'Be Your Own Windkeeper Rachel'.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: I don't think it would have sold a million copies but it would have made a nice gift for you.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Hey you guys.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Uh, sweetie we've gotta go.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: NO!

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: No?

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: No, why do we always have to do everything according to your time table?

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Actually it's the movie theatre that has the time schedule. So you don't miss the beginning.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: No, see this isn't about the movie theatre, this is about you stealing my wind.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: You go girl. I can't pull that off can I?

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Excuse me, your, your, your wind?

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Yes, my wind. How do you expect me to grow if you won't let me blow?

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: You, you know I, I don't, have a- have a problem with that.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Ok, I just, I just really need to be with myself right now. I'm sorry.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Um-um, um-um.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: You're right, I don't have to apologize. Sorry. Damnit!

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: What is it?

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: I, I don't know, it's got all this stuff about wind and trees and there's some kind of sacred pool in it. I mean, I don't really get it but she's, she's pretty upset about it.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: See, this is why I don't date women who read. Uh-oh.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: What, what's that?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: It's my VISA bill. Envelope one of two. That can't be good.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Open it, open in.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Oh my God.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Woah.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Look at this, how did I spend so much money?

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Uh Joey, that's just the minumum amount due, that's your total due.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Ahh.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: What, woah, woah, $3500 at porcelain safari?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: My animals. Hey the guy said they suited me, he spoke with an accent, I was all confused. I don't know what I'm gonna do.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Well I guess you can start by drivin a cab on Another World.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: That audition.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: That's a two line part.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Joey, you owe $1100 at I Love Lucite.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: So what.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: So suck it up man, it's a job, it's money.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Hey, look, I don't need you getting all judgemental and condescending and pedantic.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Toilet paper?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Look, I'm not being any of those things, ok, I'm just being realistic.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Well knock it off, you're supposed to be my friend.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: I am your friend.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Well then tell me things like, 'Joey you'll be fine,' and, 'Hang in there,' and, and, 'Somethin' big's fonna come along, I know it.'

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: But I don't know it. What I do know is that you owe $2300 at Isn't it Chromantic.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Hey Ross, I'm aware of what I owe.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Ok, well then get some sense. I mean it took you what, 10 years to get that job, who knows how long it's gonna be till you get another.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Look, I don't wanna hear this right now.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Huh, I'm just saying...

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Well don't just say.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Ya know, maybe, maybe I should just go.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Ok.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Ok. I'll see ya later. Just think about it, ok.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: I don't need to think about it. I was Dr. Drake Remoray. That was huge. Big things are gonna happen, you'll see. Ross, you still there?

utterance.speaker: EDDIE
utterance.content: Hey pal.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Ahhhh-gaaaahhh. Eddie what're you still doin' here?

utterance.speaker: EDDIE
utterance.content: Ah, just some basic dehydrating of a few fruits and vegetables. MAN ALIVE this thing's fantastic!

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Look Eddie, aren't you forgetting anything?

utterance.speaker: EDDIE
utterance.content: Oh yeah, that's right, look I got us a new goldfish. He's a lot fiestier that the last one.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Maybe 'cause the last one was made by Pepperidge Farm. Look Eddie, isn't there something else you're supposed to be doing right now?

utterance.speaker: EDDIE
utterance.content: Well, not unless it's got something to do with dehydrating my man because right now I'm a dehydrating maniac!

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Look you have to help me out here. I thought we had a deal. I thought by the time...

utterance.speaker: EDDIE
utterance.content: Ah-ah-ah, you know what that is?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Your last roommate's kidney?

utterance.speaker: EDDIE
utterance.content: That's a tomato. This one definitely goes in the display.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Hey Gunther, let me get a lemonade to go.

utterance.speaker: GUNTHER
utterance.content: Lemonade? You ok man?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Ah, it's career stuff. I don't know if you heard but they killed off my character on the show.

utterance.speaker: GUNTHER
utterance.content: Oh, that's too bad. How'd they do it?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: I fell down an elevator shaft.

utterance.speaker: GUNTHER
utterance.content: That sucks. I was buried in an avalanche.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: GUNTHER
utterance.content: I used to be Bryce on All My Children.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Daaahhhh!

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Aaahhhhhhh! Aaahhhh!

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Why must everybody watch me sleep? There'll be no more watching me sleep, no more watching.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: I wa-

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Uuuh.

utterance.speaker: EDDIE
utterance.content: Hey man, check it out, I got some great stuff to dehydrate here. I got some grapes, got some apricots, I thought it would be really cool to see what happens with these water balloons.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Get out. Get out, get out, get out, get out, get out, get out.

utterance.speaker: EDDIE
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: You, move out. Take your fruit, your stupid small fruit and GET OUT!

utterance.speaker: EDDIE
utterance.content: You, you want, you want me to move out?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Uh-huh.

utterance.speaker: EDDIE
utterance.content: I uh, I gotta tell you man, I mean, that's uh, it's kinda out of the blue, I mean don't you think?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: This is not out of the blue, this is smack dab in the middle of the blue.

utterance.speaker: EDDIE
utterance.content: Ohhhh. Relax, take it easy buddy. Tell me twice, you want me to go? Alright, alright, guess I'll be back for my stuff. But if you think for one second I'm leaving you alone with my fish, you're insane Jack!

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: You want some help.

utterance.speaker: EDDIE
utterance.content: No help required Chico.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: All the way to the airport huh? You know that's over 30 miles, that's gonna cost you about so bucks.

utterance.speaker: CASTING GUY
utterance.content: Excuse me, that's 50 bucks.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: CASTING GUY
utterance.content: Five oh dollars.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Ohh, you know what it is? It's smudgy 'cause they're fax pages. Now when I was on Days of Our Lives as Dr. Drake Remoray, they'd send over the whole script on real paper and everything.

utterance.speaker: CASTING GUY
utterance.content: That's great.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: And, and just so you know, if you wanted to expand this scene like, like have the cab crash or somethin', I could attend to the victims 'cause I have a background in medical acting.

utterance.speaker: CASTING GUY
utterance.content: Ok, listen, thanks for coming in.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: No no, uh, don't thank me for comin' in. Uh, at least let me finish. Uh, we could take the expressway but uh, this time of day you're better off taking the budge. You were goin' for the word bridge there weren't ya. I'll have a good day.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Ok, question number 28, have you ever allowed a lighning bearer to take your wind? I would have to say no.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: And I would have to say pah-huh.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Do you not remember the puppet guy?

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Yeah you like totally let him wash his feet in the pool of your inner power.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: And his puppet too.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Yeah ok, well at least I didn't let some guy into the forest of my righteous truth on the first date.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Who?

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Paul.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Ok, ok, ok, moving on, moving on, next question. Ok number 29, have you ever betrayed another goddess for a lightning bearer? Ok, number 30.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Woah, woah, woah, let's go back to 29.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Not uh, not to my recollection.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Huuh, alright, Danny Arshak, ninth grade. Oh, c'mon Rach, you know the bottle was totally pointing at me.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Only 'cause you took up half the circle.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Listen to you two. It's so sad. Looks like I'm gonna be going to the goddess meetings alone.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Well not when they find out you slept with Jason Hurley an hour after he broke up with Monica.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: One hour? You are such a leaf blower.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Oh hey uh, be careful with that 3-D last supper, Judas is a little loose.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Oh my God, what's goin' on?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: They're takin all my stuff back. I guess you were right.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: No look I wasn''t right, that's what I came here to tell you. I was totally hung up on, on my own stuff. Listen, I'm someone who needs the whole security thing, ya know. To know exactly where my next paycheck is coming from buy you, you don't need that and that's amazing to me. I could never do what you do Joey.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Thanks Ross.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Yeah. And you should hold out for something bigger. I can't tell you how much respect I have for you not going to that stupid cab driver audition.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: I went.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Great, how did it go?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: I didn't get it.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Good for you.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: You're livin' the dream.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Huh?

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: All right then.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Oh, not my parrot.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: I can't watch this.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Hey hold on, hold on. How much for the uh, how much to save the bird?

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Dollars? You spent $1200 dollars on a plastic bird?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Uhhh, I was an impulse buyer, near the register.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Go ahead, go ahead with the bird. Ok, do you have anything for around 200?

utterance.speaker: MOVER
utterance.content: Uh, the dog.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Huh.

utterance.speaker: MOVER
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: I'll take it. My gift to you man.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Thanks Ross. I really like that bird though...I'll take the dog though.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Here are your cakes.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: We didn't order cake.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: No, I know, they're from me. Look you guys this is not good. I mean we have enough trouble with guys stealing our wind without taking it from each other.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: You're right.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: You know.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: I love you goddesses. I don't ever want to suck your wind again.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Thank you. So are we good?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: We're good.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: We're good?

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Ok, let me take these cakes back 'cause they're gonna take that out of my paycheck.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Ding dong, the psycho's gone.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Are you sure this time?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Yes, yes I actually saw him leave. I mean that guy is standing in the window holding a human head. He is STANDING IN THE WINDOW HOLDING A HUMAN HEAD!

utterance.speaker: EDDIE
utterance.content: Check it out man, I tore it off some mannaquin in the alley behind Macy's.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: There is no alley behind Macy's.

utterance.speaker: EDDIE
utterance.content: So I got it in the junior miss department, big diff. Anyway check it out man, it's gonna make a hell of a conversation piece at out next cocktail party, huh pal?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Our next cocktail party?

utterance.speaker: EDDIE
utterance.content: Yeah, you know, put chips in it, we'll make like a chip chick.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Eddie, do you remember yesterday?

utterance.speaker: EDDIE
utterance.content: Uh yes, I think I vaguely recall it.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Do you remember talking to me yesterday?

utterance.speaker: EDDIE
utterance.content: Uh, yes.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: So what happened?

utterance.speaker: EDDIE
utterance.content: We took a road trip to Las Vegas man.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Oh sweet Moses.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: So on this road trip, did you guys win any money?

utterance.speaker: EDDIE
utterance.content: Naah, I crapped out, but Mr. 21 over here he cleans up, 300 bucks, check it out he buys me these new shoes, sweet huh?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Nice.

utterance.speaker: EDDIE
utterance.content: Yeah. Well see ya upstairs. See ya pals.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Is anyone else starting to really like him?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: May I help you?

utterance.speaker: EDDIE
utterance.content: Why doesn't my key work and what's all my stuff doin' downstairs?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Well, I'm, I'm sorry... Ahhh. Have we met?

utterance.speaker: EDDIE
utterance.content: It's Eddie you freak, your roommate.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: I, I'm sorry, I uh I already have a roommate.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Hello.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Yeah, he's lived here for years, I don't, I don't know what you're talking about man.

utterance.speaker: EDDIE
utterance.content: No he, he moved out and I moved in.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Well I, I think we'd remember something like that.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: I know I would.

utterance.speaker: EDDIE
utterance.content: Well that's uh, that's a good point. Um ok, well, uh, I guess I got the wrong apartment then. I, I'm, look, I'm, ya know, I'm sorry, I'm terriably sorry.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Hey no problem.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: See ya. Goodbuy you fruit drying psychopath. So you want me to help you unpack your stuff?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Na, na I'm ok. Oh and uh, just so you know, I'm not movin' back in 'cause I have to. Well, I mean, I do have to. It's just that that place wasn't really, I mean, this is...

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Welcome home man.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: A little foos?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Absolutely.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: What happened to the foosball?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Ah that's a cantelope.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Hey look, are we gonna have to bring this out every time Ross comes over?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: He paid a lot of money for it.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: I'm gonna hold him a different way. Look I don't understand, if you hated it so much, why did you buy it in the first place?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Well, I had a whole ceramic zoo thing goin' over there but now, without the other ones, it just looks tacky.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: So is he housetrained or is he gonna leave little bathroom tiles all over the place? Stay. Good, STAY! Good fake dog.
